nl.fontys.sevenlo.iowarrior

Class IOWarriorConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.fontys.sevenlo.iowarrior.IOWarriorConnector

  • public final class IOWarriorConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a central connection point to the IO Warriors. This class tries to open a connection to the iowarrior subsystem. On succes it created a handle for each iowarrior found, which can be used to attach to for IO operations. The handles can be used as a parameter (e.g. in the constructor) of classes that provide access to the IOWarriors functionallity. The Connector is a Singleton.
    Author:
    Pieter van den Hombergh (P.vandenHombergh at fontys.nl)

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static IOWarriorConnector getInstance()
        The singleton getter.
        Returns:
        the only instance of the connector.

      • getHandle

        public long getHandle(int i)
        Get the handle for the ith warrior. The IOWarriors are sorted in order of product id,serial number. The method will throw an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if no IOWarriors are found or if the method is called with i >= getWarriorCount;
        Parameters:
        i - the handle index requested
        Returns:
        the handle to an IOWarrior
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - when no iowarriors are available.

      • listDevices

        public void listDevices()
        List the devices.

      • getWarriorCount

        public int getWarriorCount()
        Get the number of IOWarriors connected to the system.
        Returns:
        the number of warriors

      • getHandle

        public long getHandle()
        Get the handle of the first IOWarrior found. The method returns the handle to IOWarrior with the lowest serial number attached to the system before this singleton's constructor was called. The method will throw an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException if no IOWarriors are found.
        Returns:
        a handle to an IOWarrior

      • getSerialNr

        public java.lang.String getSerialNr(int warrior)
        Get the serial number of the warrior. Used in comparison.
        Parameters:
        warrior - index in array
        Returns:
        serial number, assumed to be unique per model.

      • getSerialNr

        public java.lang.String getSerialNr(long warriorHandle)
        Get the serial number of the warrior. Used in comparison.
        Parameters:
        warriorHandle - handle for warrior
        Returns:
        serial number, assumed to be unique per model.

        Return a string representation of the iowarriors found.
